A4.text: The Catholic Church affirmed the Vulgate as its official Latin Bible at the Council of Trent (1545â€“1563), though there was no single authoritative edition of the book at that time in any language.

A5.text: The Nova Vulgata is the third and latest official Bible of the Catholic Church; it was published in 1979, and is a translation from modern critical editions of original language texts of the Bible.
